comm: fractionally short and on middle, Burns hangs back and milks a single towards square leg
84.6mph lifter, prancing delivery. Warner leaps of his feet and looks to fend it to leg. Instead, he pops it over the keeper's head
good length and on a fourth-stump line, patted towards point off the face
banged in short and just a shade outside off as Burns keeps back and diffuses it in front of mid-on
back of a length, hint of away shape outside off, Burns lets it pass
full and swerves in on middle and leg, Burns plays a weak flick and finds mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Smith flashes a cut off the toe end of the bat. Taylor flings to his left from backward point and makes a smart save
good length and Woakes explores the channel, ignored
length and seams away wide outside off, Smith lets it be
pitched further up and Woakes gets this to cut back in, Smith hunts for a booming drive through the covers and misses... Beaten on the inside edge
length and outside off, Smith pushes it to point
back of a length and targetting off, Smith ventures across off, as he often does, and blocks it. Maiden
shortish and tucking up Burns for room, Burns jams his bat down and manages an inside edge, which wanders away to the leg side
back of a length and angled in, Smith works it towards midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Smith punchily drives it to the left of mid-off and gets off the mark after seven balls
short and tests Burns outside off, he does not bother with it
first four of the day.. Pitched further up and just a shade outside off, Burns opens the face of his bat and drives it handsomely through the covers
Finn shortens his length and gets it to duck back in, Burns targets the leg side with a flick but does not connect. He takes it on his pad
back of a length and swerves back in, Smith plays back and manages an inside edge that dribbles past the leg stump
tempter wide outside off, tails away as well. Smith watches it through to the keeper
Woakes bangs it shortish and just outside off, Smith blunts it in front of the bowler
fullish and around off, clipped towards mid-on for one
good length and zips away outside off, no stroke offered
picked away off the pads to long leg, Moeen mops up in the deep
banged in short and width outside off. Smith sees it. He likes it. He slashes it up and over backward point
pitched up and comes in on off, Smith keeps back and taps a single between square leg and midwicket
full and straight as Burns turns it straight to mid-on
back of a length with some nip in, Burns judges it well and ignores
good length and curls in, Burns is squared up. He looked to flick it towards midwicket and ends up poking towards the covers
on a good length and curls back in off the seam to strike the pad. The lbw appeal amounts to nothing
fullish and some movement outside off, Smith is beaten on the drive
fuller with a hint of away movement outside off, poked out behind point
banged in short and on middle, not much sting on it as Burns skips back and pulls it firmly over backward square leg
very, very wristy! Pitched up and on off, Smith shuffles across and flicks it beautifully through midwicket
Woakes tests Smith with a short ball, he aims for a pull and inside-edges it onto his unmentionables..
good length and jags in on off, Smith flicks it tamely to mid-on
back of a length, top-of-off line, blocked to mid-off
back of a length and swerves back in alarmingly to beat the inside edge. Burns was hanging back for a defensive push. No dice..
a tad overpitched and outside off, Burns likes it there as he crunches a drive through square point. Whistles away to the boundary
beats mid-off to his left for back-to-back fours. Another half-volley outside off, driven sweetly past Morgan at mid-off. The outfield is pretty quick, despite the early-morning rain
Finn loses his radar. He slings a bouncer down leg. Burns half-ducks under it
back of a length and holds its line around off, defended in front of cover
shorter and zips away outside off, left alone
length and outside off, Smith offers no stroke. The ball brushes the back thigh en route to the keeper. It would missed off, extra bounce would also work in Smith's favour. The tracker confirms it..
back of a length and moves in off the seam as Smith is rapped on the pad, again
full and outside off, Smith shoulders arms
Smith shuffles across the off the stump as Woakes slips it over the leg stump. Smith does not connect with the flick
this time Smith connects impressively. Smith skips across off, takes it from an off-stump line and flicks it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
pretty full and seams away outside off, beating the outside edge. Smith wafts loosely and misses..
drifting onto the hips, nudged to square leg
overpitched and on the stumps, Burns offers a dead-straight bat and drills it to the left of Smith. Punchily driven to the boundary
sliding down the leg side, umpire Tim Robinson calls it a wide
shortish and directed down the leg side, helped to long leg with a controlled pull
back of a length and on off, Smith shuffles across off (should I say that?) and tucks it through backward square leg

The middle stump is tiled back. Finn shoots through Burns' gate. He has been pretty good with the drive but fails this time. This was full and curves in, Burns sets up for a drive and does not connect. Finn rips through the bat-pad gap and that's timbaaaah!
full again and nips back in sharply from outside off. Nearly shaved the off stump. Tight, tight leave from Bailey
full and on a fourth-stump line, Smith inches forward and answers with a dead bat
back of a length and around off, Smith jumps across off and blocks it in front of mid-on
Smith brings his dexterous wrists into play, again. Overpitched and around off, Smith gives it marching orders through midwicket with another sublime flick
full and probes away outside off, Smith swishes his bat out of the way
fullish and around off, defensive push to mid-off
full and comes in, Smith flits around in the crease and dribbles it back to the bowler
fullish and on middle and leg, clipped through backward square leg
short and lifts outside off, Bailey hoists his bat above his shoulder and leaves
picked away from a middle-and-leg line through backward square leg
length and outside off, left alone
that's so pretty that it should be danced to at weddings. This was a bit overpitched and outside off, Bailey eases forward and caresses it to the right of mid-off
short and climbs outside off Bailey rides it to third man
pitched up and on off, patted to mid-off off the front foot
tight line on off, brings Bailey forward into another defensive push, this time back to the bowler
veering onto the pads, glanced down to long leg
half-volley on middle, drilled back to the bowler, who goes low to his right in his follow-through and stops the ball
length and on off, blocked to leg
full and attacking off, Bailey hangs back and defends to mid-on
good length and holds its line around off, played to the covers
back of a length and too wide outside off, Smith has left the cut shot in the locker
back of a length and on middle, blocked in front of mid-on
dug in short and outside off, Smith skips across off and drags an attempted pull past midwicket
Bailey strides forward and laces this full ball from outside off to mid-off
fullish and comes in on off, tapped to mid-off. Testing over from Plunkett
slung down leg, wide. Inauspicious start for Stokes
short and on middle, Smith swivels on the back foot and controls a pull, sending it fine. Long leg is a lot squarer
pitched up and outside off, driven towards the covers
full and straight, tickled to the left of the keeper
pitched up and no lateral movement outside off, driven down the ground
shortish and outside off, jabbing punch to point
fullish and outside off, he comes forward and drives it nicely behind point
Bailey takes this short ball from outside off and pulls firmly behind square on the leg side
length and comes in, Smith keeps back and nudges it through square leg
back of a length and cuts back in to smack Bailey high on back thigh. It would have sailed over the stumps
good length and nips back in from outside off at 142.3ks, slices Bailey into half and beats the inside edge. Looked like a quick offcutter
back of a length and outside off, Bailey punches and finds mid-off
length and angled in, carefully defended off the back foot
pitched up and outside off, no stroke offered
full and at the stumps, whippy-punch to mid-on
full and tails in, Bailey mis-hits a flick to mid-on
dug in shortish and outside off, dabbed in front of the covers
length and just a shade outside off, blocked up to the covers
short and rises on off, Smith milks it through midwicket
fullish and on off, picked away through backward square leg
pitched up and on off, clipped through backward square leg, again
back of a length and outside off, slapped through the covers. Taylor runs across to his right from sweeper, dives and makes an agile stop
hurled in full on middle, dug out
back of a length, punched to the off-side sweeper from outside off
pitched up and outside off, Smith loads up for a cover-drive and ends up skewing it to midwicket
short and wide to start, not the best of beginnings. Bailey hangs back and cuts late in front of point for two
better. A bit of flight and closer to a sixth-stump line, not a lot of spin but enough. Bailey leaves
drifts on Bailey's legs this time, Bailey stays back and nudges off his pads to deep square leg
pushed through a bit flat with no flight, ends up a tad short. Smith punches down to long-off
nice use of the feet this time, some air from Rashid but Bailey dances down the track and drives to long-off
well-landed. Tossed up close to off stump, Smith gets on the front foot and drives to cover off the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, hustles Bailey for pace a touch who is on his toes while clipping to deep square leg
overpitched on middle this time, Smith plays to mid-on with the angle and sets off for a run immediately.
back of a length but Plunkett misses his line once more, Bailey hangs back and swivel-pulls to fine leg
easy for Smith. Meat and drink for Smudge, stays back and tickles off the middle stump line to deep square leg
better lines, just outside off on a good length. Bailey rocks back again but tamely pats it towards the off side
poor ball and punished by Bailey. Full length drifting down the leg side, Bailey is set now and clips uppishly but picks the gap between fine leg and square leg easily. Not great lines from Plunkett
tossed up outside off, Smith skips down the track and drives back to the bowler
rank long hop, extremely poor delivery but these are occasionally dished up by legspinners. Smith rocks back and pulls powerfully in the gap at deep square leg
flighted outside off, Smith anticipated the change in length after the previous delivery and comes down the track to drive to long-of
googly outside off, driven back to the bowler
a bit too much flight and Bailey advances down the track and meets the ball as it pitches to drive comfortably through cover for another boundary
fullish length on middle and leg, Bailey comes forward and drills to long-on
they steal a single, fullish outside off on a fuller length, Bailey drives towards cover who makes a good diving half-stop, but the pair quickly decide there is a run
shortish length outside off, Smith walks across in trademark fashion to tuck to deep square leg
just a touch short and Bailey quickly latches onto that length on middle stump. He rocks back quickly and whips the pull in the gap behind square again
aah, the fast-bowler's response. Very short on off stump, loops over the batsmans' head and is called wide
better delivery, bowled from wider of the crease on a good length around off, calmly defended by Bailey
a touch of width outside off on a fullish length, Bailey finds points with his cut
87.2 mph, good finish by Stokes. Full outside off coming in with the angle, Bailey drives to point off the front foot
nicely bowled. Not too much flight, not too flat outside off. Smith gets forward and blocks
48.8 mph, tossed up outside off, Smith comes forward and drives to cover
nice use of the feet and wrists, flighted again on off and middle, Smith advances down and whips to long-on
terrific shot, beautifully executed. Very full and wide with some air, Bailey picks his gap early and unfurls a uppish lofted drive over cover which lands just short of the boundary
opens the face of the bat to run the ball in front of point for one
pushed through flatter this time on off, Smith stays back and pushes to cover. Better delivery with Smith in two minds as to how to play it
fuller length again just outside off - fifth-stump line, defended to cover off the front foot
nicely bowled. just a bit of nip into Bailey from outside off, Bailey clips to midwicket just in time
misses his length totally, very high full toss outside off, Bailey swipes late to mid-off.
short outside off, Bailey plays a similar swipe straight to mid-on and Finn takes an easy catch
decent comeback by Stokes this, good length on a fourth-stump line, Bailey pushes to cover with not much feet movement
nice running by Bailey. Fuller than a good length on off, Bailey pushes to mid-on with soft hands and immediately calls for one. They make it with ease but there is a fumble as well
not a bad over at all by Stokes in spite of the no ball. Fullish once more outside off, defended into the cover region
48.7 mph, full on middle, use of the feet to get to the pitch of the ball and drive to long-on
flighted again, Smith comes down again and converts it into a yorker, squeezes the ball to long-off
very full again with lots of air, picked to midwicket
tossed up again outside of, Bailey dances down the track and drives to long-off with the turn
what a shot, some more flight outside off, Smith comes down and whips the ball to midwicket with discernible use of the wrists.
nice from Bailey, just picking the singles. He comes down to meet the ball as it pitches and drives to long-off with no trouble whatsoever
shortish length on middle, Bailey looks to swivel-pull again but the ball rolls towards fine leg off the pad
80 mph, fuller than a good length on middle, Smith won't miss out on some easy runs. Nudges easily off his pads to deep square leg
much fuller outside off, driven to cover with minimal feet movement
86 mph, shorter than a good length outside off. Lovely lines these from Stokes. Bailey rocks back to defend into the cover region
beaten outside off. The good lengths and lines are working. Just a tad wide on a good length, Bailey tries to force through point but the ball is too close to him, misses his waft
shortish length again outside off, Bailey chops into the ground off the back foot  towards point
good stuff to start, full on off. Bailey cannot do much with that other than block back
84.8 mph, fifty for Bailey. Great innings by him. Kept the run-rate high. Fullish outside off, skewed off to the sweeper
very very full on leg, maybe going down leg. Smith surprisingly misses his flick and there is an appeal but there was a big inside edge
fuller again on a fifth-stump line, blocked out to cover
forced through cover for two. Very full again on or outside off, Smith opens the face to get the gap at cover

oh beautiful shot, equally good fielding at the deep square leg boundary by Hales. Overpitched on leg and Smith delectably flicks uppishly but Hales is quick on the ball to keep the ball in the field of play

two more, nice batting this. Fullish on off coming win with the angle generated by Stokes, Bailey clips just past midwicket and no hesitation in the second but a direct hit from the deep square leg fielder would have had him
good length on off, skewed back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
short and wide, should have found a gap - any gap. But Bailey finds point with his cut
well bowled and well played. Quick and full on off, Bailey gets a good stride forward to defend
good length but just a hint of room which is enough for GB to open the face of the bat and drive to the sweeper cover off the back foot

fifty for Smith now. Great innings by him too, coming in the first over. His runs in London continue to flow. Full and wide outside off, Smith throws his hands at the ball to get it in front of point for four.
full but drifts on Bailey's pads who is hustled for pace, hits his pads and rolls off to square leg
85.2 kph, very full just down leg. Smith walks across and misses the flick, just misses the leg stump. Rightly not called a wide
too full on his pads, England cannot bowl there to Smith. Easily worked off his pads behind square for two more
better line but a bit too wide this time. Smith opens the face of the bat to dab to third man
edged to third man. Good length outside off, straightened a touch helping kiss the outside edge.

84.6 mph, full on middle, not great bowling. Smith whips the ball straight to midwicket where Taylor picks up and throws directly at the non-strikers end but Bailey is back. Easy decision for the third umpire
nicely tossed up on a good length, Bailey skips down to clip to midwicket

and the change works. Maybe a loss in concentration by Bailey but that turned a mile. Beautiful drift by Moeen. Tossed up outside off with plenty of drift, pitches outside off and spins in to beat Bailey's flaying bat and take leg stump. Not only an offspinner's dream ball but a very vital wicket too.
very full on middle, drilled to midwicket
some more spin, fuller outside off, spinning into Maxwell who is struck on the pads outside off
fuller again, clipped to midwicket with the turn
better shout this time, but lots of doubt again. Tossed up outside off and comes in to hit Maxwell's pads but outside the line again.
shorter than a good length on middle, Smith shuffles across to work the ball to deep square leg
good length just outside off, Maxwell stays back and defends into the off side with a straight bat
overpitched on middle this time, Maxwell squirts the ball to cover. A bit pacey for Maxwell
edged and four. No slip and the ball goes through that second slip region. Good length outside off and Maxwell prods at it to get a genuine nick
nicely played this time, a bit too full and Maxwell leans into his drive through cover. Moeen dives nicely to keep it to two
fuller again outside off, drilled to cover off the front foot
too much flight this time by Moeen, Smith works with the spin to long-on
a repeat shot, a bit too full again and Maxwell finds long-on with the whip
worked with the wrists this time, fullish on off, Smith uses his wrists to clip to deep square leg
full toss outside off. Maxwell drives to long-on again
nicely tossed up outside off, Smith advances and nudges but finds square leg
some more flight, some more good batting with the turn to long-on. Nice batting by Smith. Just biding his time now
was that a googly? Probably. Outside off coming in, Smith doesn't really pick the variation and pushes back to the bowler
lots of turn again, but slow turn. Tossed up outside off, Smith stays in his crease and works the ball against the spin to midwicket
picks the gap this time, for two. Too full and on middle and leg, Smith works off his pads to deep square leg
short and wide, easily cut away in front of point. He'll get an easy two
tossed up outside off, Smith comes down and converts the flight into a full toss before whipping to deep midwicket
nicely flighted and well landed on off, Maxwell defensively pushes to midwicket
smashed back at Moeen. Tossed up outside off, Smith comes down and clobbers a drive back to Moeen on the bounce
stays in his crease this time to drive through cover for one. Ali giving the ball plenty of air here
right in Maxwell's arc. Tossed up down leg, Maxwell gets down on one knee and plays a uppsish, powerful sweep behind square for four
shorter on middle, Maxwell rocks back and clips to square leg with soft hands allowing the pair to get through for two. Nice battin'
almost picks out deep midwicket. Full outside off, Maxwell stays in his crease and uppishly sweeps on the bounce to Stokes
nicely played once again by Smudge all along the ground. Lets the ball spin into him from outside off before working the ball to deep midwicket. Two more
some more flight outside off, Maxwell belts the drive down to long-off
beautiful batting by Smith again, skips down the track and chips the ball in the air over midwicket for two.

oh, he's gone this time. Tame dismissal for Smith. He is distraught, nothing wicket for Rashid. Tossed up nicely outside off and Smith looks to drive through cover but the ball skews to point off the outer half of the bat
full toss outside off, Watson comes down and drives to long-off
overpitched on middle, drilled to long-on. Not much turn
51.5 mph, fuller outside off and patted to cover off the front foot
flighted on off, Maxi bends forward to smother it
quicker through the air around off, kept out
fullish and around off, driven smoothly to long-on
length and on off, Watson strides forward as he pushes it to the covers
this one grips in the pitch and turns in with extra bounce, Watson takes it on his stomach
pushed through on middle, flicked through midwicket
looped up and outside off, laced to long-off
horrid short ball on a leg-stump line, Maxwell skips back and pummels a pull over backward square leg. Launched into the second-tier
tossed up on off, tapped to the covers
good length and around off, defended
slower through the air, poked out to the covers
flatter and on off, Maxi goes back and punches it down to long-on
quicker through the air, tucked around the corner
turns in from outside off, glanced fine on the leg side
loopier on off, Maxi answers with a dead bat
pushed through on off, Maxi unleashes the reverse-sweep and hits it through backward point
fullish and on middle, knocked to the leg side
tossed up, flicked to midwicket, where the fielder dives to his right and intercepts it
low full toss, dips in on middle, as Finn does not nail the yorker. Clipped to short midwicket
tight line on off, Watson inches forward and drops it in front of the covers
dug in shortish and on off, Watson rocks back and pulls it to deep midwicket. It does not carry to Alex Hales, he does well to dive and take it on the half-volley
length and outside off, Maxwell can't run it down to third man. Beaten
back of a length and on middle, eased to long leg
pitched up and outside off, right in Watson's driving slot. He bends his knee and drills it to short cover, where Taylor makes a half-save
length, non-turning ball on off, turned through midwicket
Maxwell goes low, takes this from outside off and sweeps it behind square
tossed up on off, Watson steps out and flicks it through square leg
What a strike from Maxwell. Full and on off, Maxwell runs down the track and marmalises it over long-off
loads of bottom-handed power, again! Similar ball, straight roller around off. Maxwell clears his front leg and launches it over long-off
pushed through quicker, Maxwell takes it on a full toss and sweeps it away to the deep midwicket fence
dug in short and on middle, controlled pull to deep square leg
shortish and on off, helped to long leg with a whirl of the wrists
back of a length with some away movement in the channel. Watson is squared up as he thick-edges it past backward point to the right of deep third man
length and around off, Watson gets another edge down to third man

No fifty for Maxwell. Umpire Dharmasena's finger goes up. Maxwell has a chat with Watson and decides not to review. Nice and full and on middle, Maxwell shuffles across and topples over the flick as he is rapped on the front pad. Trapped in front..
back of a length and around off, Marsh camps on the back foot and defends it to short cover
fullish and on off, clipped to mid-on
Watson paddle-sweeps this from well outside off to fine leg
slides on middle and leg, tucked behind square
flat offbreak on off, forced to deep midwicket with the wrists
pushed through on a fourth-stump line, worked to midwicket
full and on middle, Marsh bisects it between mid-on and short midwicket with a wristy flick. Not as wristy as Steven Smith, though
darted full on off, not a pin-point yorker. Squeezed out to off
pitched up and on off, Watson clatters a drive to mid-off. Morgan dives full-stretch to his right and stops the ball. Super-sharp fielding..
lifting ball outside off, check-flicked over square leg
back of a length and outside off, Watson cracks a cut to the left of a leaping backward point. He beats deep third man to his right
full and on off, punchily driven but straight to mid-on
back of a length, Watson aims to flick and pops it in front of extra-cover off a leading edge. Roy runs in, attacks the ball, but it does down in front of him
length and on off, ugly-looking slog-sweep to midwicket
pushed through quicker on the stumps, Marsh skips down the track and lustily clubs it over cow corner
slides on off, down the track and swiped to deep midwicket off the inside half of the bat
flat ball, spins in from outside off. Watson wants to over-hit the pull but misses
massive, massive blow from Watson. Tossed up, Watson nips down the track and punts it forcefully over long-on
and Watson finishes it with another six. Straight ball, Watson sizes it up and pastes a slog-sweep over deep midwicket. Australia are turning it on at Lord's.. Launched into the top-tier
shortish and on middle, chipped over midwicket
Marsh dances down the track, Finn is wary of it as he shortens his length. Slapped away over the covers. Two fielders look to cut off the ball in the deep. No dice
too full and straight, picked away through backward square leg
might have been a slower ball, Marsh comes down the track. Swings and misses. Hoodwinked by the change of pace
slower, short ball, outside off. Marsh can't manufacture his own pace as he drags it to deep midwicket
short and outside off, Watson waits on it before late-cutting it down to third man
back of a length and on middle, Watson steps away, makes room and manages an inside edge to long leg
good length and on middle, Watson looks to manufacture room again but checks his stroke and ends up dabbing it to the covers
fired full and on middle, Watson slinks away outside leg and skews it away to the left of the keeper
Stokes does not get hold of a yorker outside off. He serves up a yorker. Instead of smashing it out of London, Marsh does not connect
back of a length and outside off, Marsh flat-bat thumps it ram-rod straight, sends it clattering away to the boundary
back of a length and on a leg-stump line, punched to long-on
slung miles wide outside off, past the tram-line
full and outside off, Marsh thrashes a drive to long-off
back of a length and on off, Watson winds up and drills it straight to mid-off
back of a length and on middle, slugged away to long-on
too full and wide outside off, cracked to sweeper cover with a bent knee
low full toss on middle, hacked away to mid-off (Plunkett), who dives to his left and stops the ball
Woakes spears a yorker just outside off, Watson can't slice it away
Stokes goes wide of the crease and angled it full on middle, Marsh gets under it and skelps it over long-on
yorker, Marsh jams his bat down and manages an inside edge, which wanders away in front of the covers. They set off for a speedy single
Stokes fires a yorker on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
pretty full and on off, Watson makes room and crashes it to the covers
banged in short and on middle, Stokes hustles Marsh for pace. Miscues a pull over midwicket

Watson missed a kick in the T20I, he was a victim of a poor call and was run-out in the first ODI, he has holed off a low full toss in this game. Watson did not get under this properly and hit it straight down the throat of long-on. Stokes fires in a wicked stare...
low full toss outside off, slapped to the covers
hacked away to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
Woakes tests Wade with a short ball on middle, which is pulled strongly over backward square leg. Marsh wanted the second but is sent back
fullish and outside off, hoisted over the covers
low full toss outside off, Marsh tonks it to the left of long-on for six

Fifty for Marsh. Roy nearly pulled off a stunning catch. Full in length and outside off, thumped to sweeper cover. Roy moves to his right, leaps off his feet, stretches out his right hand but can't snap it up. Neither can he flick it back into play. The ball pops out and sneaks away to the boundary

short, lifting ball outside off. Wade is hurried onto a pull, he skews it in the air off a top edge, which is swallowed by Stokes himself. Simple return catch. The batsmen cross over and Marsh will be on strike
slower, full ball on off from the back of the hand. Marsh spots it and dispatches it over mid-off. The hat-trick is averted
veering down leg, diverted fine with the angle. Easy pickings..
full toss on off as Stokes misses the yorker, lofted over mid-off for another four
full and on middle and leg, whipped through midwicket

Marsh pops it behind off the last ball of the innings. Short, slower ball down the leg side at 110.4ks. Marsh was far too early into the pull and could only glove it to Buttler. Marsh has done his job, though, muscling Australia past 300
nice line to start. Not much movement. Good length, outside off. Roy decides to leave
good length outside off. No swing yet. Roy awkwardly pushes into the off side off the back foot
short and wide, Roy tries to cut but misses. Too wide outside off and is called
fullish length on a fourth-stump line. Roy square-drives to point off the front foot. No swing in this over so far
maybe, just a hint of in-swing there. Not a lot though. Full outside off, driven back to the bowler
very full but too wide, pushed across the right-hander this time, looking to get Roy driving. But it is too wide and Roy leaves
angled across the right-hander once more outside off. Roy comes forward, gets a good front foot stride, leans into the drive and finds the gap through extra cover with exemplary timing.
89.2 mph, shortish length outside off, Roy pats the ball into the off side off the back foot
nice swing for NCN. Full outside off, moving away from Hales who looks to drive but the swing takes the ball past the defensive prod
86.6 mph, fullish again but drifting on middle and leg, Hales clips off his pads through square leg
87.3 mph, full again outside off. No movement this time. Roy comes forward and pushes the drive through cover. Just timing, no hard hands by Roy. Races to the boundary
another one, just really good use of the hands and good timing. Full on middle stump, Roy just pushes the ball into the gap through midwicket. Great batting
good length outside off, better length and line. Roy presents the full face of the bat to block
89 mph, another boundary for Roy. Elegant stuff. Slightly too full on middle again, Roy drives through midwicket nicely for the second time in the over. Exceptional timing
87 mph, short outside off, good channel there. Hales stays on the back foot and pushes into the off side
fuller this time from Starc, angling across Hales who drives to point.
good bouncer outside off. Dug in halfway down, Hales tries to pull but the line is too good. The pull is missed
90 mph, good pace here from Starc. Good length in that channel again who drives to cover
smashed on the helmet this time. Good bouncer again towards the badge, Hales looks to get under it but is a bit late and he is clipped on the helmet. Wade collects nicely too
there it is, the full inswinger. Not much swing though and Hales is expecting it who flicks nicely through midwicket. Starc oversteps too
low full toss outside off from Starc. Not a bad delivery at all. Hales gives himself room and therefore just about gets bat on it to drive to mid-off
shortish outside off, the ball rising a touch. Roy stands tall and cut-punches into the off side
full on middle stump, no swing. Driven to mid-on
short and wide again, this time Roy connects sweetly with the cut. However, Burns at cover dives nicely to stop
short and wide again, closer to off stump but still too much width. Roy cuts to point off the back foot
fuller length outside off, nicely driven to mid-off.
maiden from NCN. Nice comeback. Good length nipping back into Roy who inside-edges onto his pads.
graceful, elegant, delectable, whatever you like. Full and wide, Hales gets a nice front stride and leans into the drive, plays it late and under his eyes to find the gap through cover point
drags his length back immediately does Starc. Good length outside off, driven to cover
goes fuller again outside off, maybe a fourth-stump line. Driven off the front foot to mid-off
and goes back short again, shorter than a good length on off, Hales stands tall and punchily-cuts to point
89 mph, very short bouncer on middle and leg. Hales, this time however, gets under it nice and early
very full outside off, squirted down to third man off the front foot
shortish length well outside off, cut off the back foot to cover point
86 mph, and there is another boundary. Too full outside off, Hales drives into the gap through extra cover with not much feet movement. Four nonetheless
better stuff, good length in that channel outside off. hales finds point with the square cut
short and another boundary. This is good to watch. Doesn't get up high enough and sits up for Hales to pull in front of square leg for yet another boundary

what a catch. Stunning stuff from Smith. Absolutely stunning. Fuller length outside off, Hales skews the drive off the outer half of the bat towards short cover where Smith is lurking, he dives high to his right to take a spectacular, two-handed catch.
full outside off, driven to cover off the front foot
very full outside off and driven beautifully and elegantly through extra cover for yet another boundary
shortish length on off, blocked off the front foot
89 mph, angled across Roy who decides to leave this alone. Better lengths and lines from Starc, but can he be consistent
driven uppishly once more. Cross-seam from Starc outside off, Roy throws his hands through the drive but the ball  bounces well short of mid-off
better stuff from Starc. Fuller than a good length outside off, Roy sees no reason to play and leaves
89 mph, full and wide outside off, squeezed down to third man off the front foot
half-volley on middle. Driven to mid-on
86 mph, fuller again outside off, Taylor drives but the ball goes towards point
good length on of, great bowling by NCN. Taylor can only block back to the bowler
shorter than a good length again, Taylor pushes to point off the front foot
84 mph, short and a bit of width for Taylor who slashes at the ball and gets a thick outside edge which goes uppishly to third man
excellent end. full on off stump. Roy gets a thick outside edge all along the ground to third man

79 mph, did that carry? May have just carried to Agar at fine leg. May have not. Good length on middle and Roy swivel-pulls uppishly towards fine leg, Agar makes a lot of ground but fell just short. Good effort
good length on off again, Taylor cannot do much with these. He blocks into the off side
and again. Accuracy from Marsh. Shortish length in that channel once more. Taylor bunts it down the pitch
strays in line this time. Goes down leg , Taylor misses his flick and is rapped high on the pads, the ball goes to fine leg allowing them a leg bye
81 mph, good stuff. Fuller than a good length on the fifth-stump line, Roy pats the ball into the off side
ah, nice shot by Roy. Very full outside off, Roy drives off the front foot past the bowler. Goes straight down the ground for the 10th boundary in England's 50.
shortish length outside off, slapped to point off the front foot
yorker this time well outside off, Taylor digs it out to cover
misses his length but Taylor misses runs. Low full toss outside the off stump, Taylor finds no gap but finds cover
excellent pressure being created on JT. Very good line just outside off on a good length, Taylor tries to force through mid-off but finds him

and the pressure almost tells. Hmm, interesting. Very full outside off, Taylor advances to try and work through leg side but the thick outside edge carries to cover who dives to his right but cannot hang on
finally finds the gap. Very full outside off, Taylor squeezes the drive past the diving short cover and this will be another boundary
oh, Marsh strays in line once again and there are another four runs for England. Races to the fine leg boundary of Roy's pads after he missed the whip
nice line. Good line on middle but Roy gets a single. Clips it to deep square leg off the front foot
and another single. Much better from these two. Taylor taps the length ball towards mid-on and sets off for a quick run, makes it without any trouble
fuller than a good length nipping back in to Roy, who tries to dab to third man but the in movement allows him to guide towards the keeper
comes back in again from outside off, Roy looks to steer to third man again but he gets a thick inside edge. Taylor is quick on the opportunity for the single and takes it.
84 mph, full on Taylor's pads. Whipped off the front foot to fine leg

dropped. An absolute sitter has been spilled. Wow. Short and wide, a bit of extra bounce on that. Taylor flays at the ball again and gets a thick outside edge which carries to Stoinis at third man. Grassed. Just went through his hands
worked off his pads to deep square leg
massive cheer for Stoinis as he fields the ball this time. Short and wide again from Cummins, cut down to third man off the front foot

gone this time. Roy has thrown another one away. Very poor shot considering the circumstances. Full outside off, cross-seam, maybe generating some extra bounce. Roy, however, loosely wafts at the ball and gets a thick outside edge. Wade takes a good diving catch to his right.
oh, brute of a delivery first up. Great direction of the bouncer by Cummins. Morgan fends awkwardly off the back foot without looking at the ball, takes his glove and then to fine leg. Welcome, Eoin.
short and wide, Taylor misses the cut again. Lots of opportunities to score have been missed
80 mph, length on leg stump. Morgan whips nicely off his pads to deep square leg
nicely played this time from Taylor. Walks across his stumps to work the length ball outside off to deep square leg. Made the single there
just a bit of away movement. Full outside off, inviting the drive from Morgan who obliges. The away movement takes the outside half to he bat to third man for one
fullish length outside off, Taylor forces the ball to cover
good stuff from Marsh. Full outside off, defended to cover
nicely played by Taylor, good length outside off, steered to third man off the front foot
shortish and some width outside off, Taylor hops and chops it past point
back of a length and cuts back in off the seam at 90mph, Taylor throws his bat at a drive as the ball zips past the inside edge
full at the off stump, Taylor comes forward and pushes it to the covers
bangs this short and outside off, Taylor wants to cut it away but chops it in front of point. Perhaps, he tried to over-hit this
full and on off at 92mph, forward and driven straight back to the bowler
Cummins teases Taylor outside off. More short stuff and chopped to third man
good length and just a shade outside off, Taylor looks to drive and gets an inside edge onto the pad
strong pull. Short and outside off, he gets on top of the bounce and crunches it away to the left of midwicket. Mid-on had no chance as well..
dug in short, the line is much tighter on off. He hops and quells it in front of his feet
good length and on middle, deftly glanced to long leg
full and outside off as Morgan reaches out and square-drives it to point
good length and on middle and leg, shoots low. But Morgan handles it well enough, clipping it through midwicket
bumper down the leg side, Morgan ducks under it with ease
short and ill-directed down leg, diverted away to long leg
slid down the leg side again. Perhaps, Cummins is looking to bust the speedometer even further..
nice and full on middle, Morgan hangs back and blocks it
leg-side ball, which is helped past deepish short leg
prickly line outside off, played up to cover
back of a length and zeroed in on the top of off, dabbed towards point
Fast hands and good timing. Taylor fetches this short ball from outside off and dispatches it to the deep midwicket boundary
dragged short and wide outside off, Morgan leans back and cuts it firmly to sweeper cover
looped up and around off, sliced in front of point
Maxi errs short and offers width as well, Morgan brings out a cut through backward point
slides on outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
flighted and on middle, Taylor pre-meditates a lap-sweep and toe-ends it in front of the bowler
down the track, Taylor manages to get somewhat close to the pitch and drives a single to long-on
ample leeway outside off, Taylor flays it up and over backward point. Cummins' pace does the rest..
hurled full and targetting the stumps, squeezed back to the bowler
short, wide, and punished again. Taylor clunks a cut to the right of a diving backward point
fullish and just a shade outside off, dinked to point
fuller and on off, pushed down to mid-off
90.4mph, hurries on a length and on middle, nurdled in front of short midwicket
fired on off, down the track and makes a mess of a drive. He gets an inner edge onto the pad. The ball dribbles behind but Taylor gets back to the safety zone
flat and just outside off, chopped to the covers
slides on middle as Morgan camps back and dabs it in front of point
spins in on middle and off, ticked in front of square leg
sharper offbreak, which is inside-edged behind square
fizzes through on off, tapped in front of square on the off side
low full toss on middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket
good length and outside off, steered down to third man
full and outside off, down the track and sliced over the covers
full and outside off, weak drive to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, late cut to third man
full and on middle and leg, whipped away to deep midwicket
pushed through on middle, paddle swept or rather toe ended to long leg
low full toss outside, mistimed drive to the covers
straight roller on middle, blocked from the crease
Morgan hangs back in the crease and works it through midwicket
pitched up and on off, eased down to long-on after jumping out of the crease
nice and full and on off, Taylor tips forward and defends it to the covers
Taylor nicks behind. Good length and largely holds its line outside off, Taylor seeks to run it fine to third man. But can only outside-edge it to Wade. Marsh takes high-fives from his team-mates
full and on middle, skewed through square leg off an inside edge
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Stokes now misses the attempted dab to third man
lifting delivery outside off, Stokes gets on top of the bounce and punchily plays it to point
length and outside off, sliced drive to third man
turn and bounce outside off, Morgan shoulders arms
this slides on outside off, Morgan rocks back and cuts it to the right of backward point. Sweet timing. First four for Morgan
tossed up and outside off, Morgan checks his lofted strike and chips it over the covers. Starc hauls the ball in by the edge of the boundary
pushed through quicker, he misses the flick and takes it on the pad. This was snaking down leg
straight ball on middle, blocked from the crease
tickled off the pads to short fine leg
back of a length and just a shade outside off, blocked to short cover
bouncer down the leg side, Morgan rocks his head out of the way
back of a length and outside off, late-cut to third man
full and slanted across off, left well alone
full and on middle and leg, directed through square leg with a roll of the wrists
short and wide outside off, forced to point
pushed through on middle, tucked through midwicket
slides on flat and outside off, punched to cover
shortish and outside off, cut to cover, again
whipped through midwicket as this was flat and quick
dropped short and outside off, cut away behind point. The ball spins away from Agar, who had over-run and messed it up
tossed up on middle, laced to long-off
full and wide outside off, Morgan drives loosely and misses
too full and outside off, forward and driven through the covers
nice and full outside off again, Stokes wants to thrash a cover-drive but edges it through vacant slip

pretty full and on the stumps at 145ks, Stokes drives back to the bowler, who stretches his left hand and plucks it out. He has a aim at the stumps (sensing a run-out chance), Stokes, who is out of the crease, fends the throw off with his left glove/ instinctively looks to protect himself, as he loses his balance and collapses on the floor. Wade goes up. Starc appeals. Umpires Dharmasena and Robinson converge. The soft signal is not out. Stokes has been given out obstructing the field by the TV umpire Joe Wilson. Smith, Morgan intervene and have a chat with the umpires. Boos ring around Lord's. Morgan isn't happy. Stokes drags himself off the field. Roy, in the balcony, can't believe it. Drama! Drama!
back of a length and on middle, worked to leg
tight line outside off, dabbed to point
flat and quick, short-arm pull through midwicket

an appeal for lbw, Tim Robinson does not budge. Australia want a review. Maxi's front foot is fine. Flighted on middle, with a hint of turn. He misses the defensive push, is beaten on the inside edge and is rapped on the front pad. The ball pitched in line, impact in line, it would have hit the top of middle. Buttler is sent packing for a three-ball duck..
dips in on middle and leg, knocked in front of midwicket
flat and darted on off, punched to mid-on
nudged off the pads behind square
slides on off, kept out off the back foot
back of a length and around off, inside-edges it onto his pad
dug in short and outside off, lashed to third man. No-ball called and boos turn into cheers
Starc hurls a yorker, Moeen does not meet with a flick and takes a leg-bye
full and on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
pitched up and on middle, driven back to the bowler
too full and down leg, helped fine on the leg side. 150 up for the hosts
yorker on off, dug out
looped up on middle, defended
flat and turning away, punched through point
fullish and on middle, driven to mid-off
Starc almost takes it on a rebound. Reverse-swept forcefully to short third man, where Starc leaps off his feet, pops the ball higher, only to shell it on the rebound. It's all happening at Lord's
darted at 90.7ks, kept out
shortish and on the hips, flipped through the gap at midwicket
banged in short and on middle, Moeen seeks to pull and top-edges it, does not carry to deep square
shortish and slides away outside off, glided to third man
back of a length and outside off, under-edges it to the keeper
wide outside off, Moeen secures a single to third man
banged in short, he looks to pull and drags it behind off an inside edge
straight ball on middle, blocked
pushed through on middle, blocked, again
slides on outside off, Morgan leans back and cuts it to point
'caatch' is the cry but Morgan clears mid-on, who was running back. Tossed up, Morgan takes the aerial route and lofts it over the fielder
fuller and on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
length and around off, dabbed to point
back of a length and on middle, defended back to the bowler
nice and full on middle and leg, tapped back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, rides it down to third man
shortish ball outside off, blocked
short and outside off, lashed to deep cover
keeps it short and outside off, steered down to third man.
slow offspin from Maxi on off, Morgan rocks back to work towards long-on
was that a drop? Very hard catch though. Offspin from outside off, Moeen looks to cut and gets a thick outside edge, Smith dives to his right but cannot hold onto a tough chance

gone this time. Moeen goes. Another rather soft wicket. Moeen gets down to sweep and gets a thick top edge, the ball flies off towards deep square leg who settles under it early and takes an easy catch. Nothing delivery from Maxwell but England in serious trouble now.
nicely tossed up outside off, Morgan gets inside the line and opens the face to guide the ball in front of cover
flighted from outside off, Woakes gets forward and blocks
pushed through wide outside off, Woakes harmlessly pats to short third man
short on leg, worked down to fine leg with a pull
86 mph, good length on off, Woakes defends into the off side off the front foot
shorter length on off stump. Good channel. Pushed into the leg side towards mid-on
nicely played, runs the length ball outside off with the open face towards the third man boundary. Good batting
shorter length outside off, rises up from a length. Beats Woakes' attempted steer
fullish length this time outside off, pushed into the cover region for the one
tossed up outside off, clipped to midwicket off the front foot
flighted again outside off, whipped off past midwicket for one
short and wide, nicely played by Morgan. Hangs back and cuts the ball in front of cover off the front foot to bring up his fifty. Excellent fighting innings from the captain
full on middle, drilled back to the bowler
slightly short on middle and off, Morgan rocks back before turning the ball towards deep midwicket
flight from around the wicket, Woakes works the ball with the turn to midwicket
87 mph, shortish delivery outside off, Morgan ramps the ball down to third man
nice timing, full outside off, Woakes nicely drives the ball on the up to mid-off, cannot find the gap though

is that out? Given. Woakes goes now. England falling apart. Woakes looks to swivel-pull the ball into the leg side but gets a thick inside edge which carries low to Wade. Lord's is quiet. The Stokes dismissal has had a bearing impact on the game.
short on the hips and Rashid works the ball towards midwicket for one
nice bouncer. Well directed again by Cummins. Morgan hangs back and the ball hits the handle of the bat, Morgan withdraws his hands just in time.

he gets clipped on the helmet this time. Cummins goes up to Morgan immediately to enquire about his well being. Another excellently directed bouncer towards the badge, Morgan takes his eyes off the ball and tries to evade the bouncer. As he looks away, the back of the head is vulnerable. Just about got the helmet. Could have been very nasty. Morgan isn't wearing the protective part at the back of the helmet. He is fine though
good length delivery outside off, Rashid works the ball with the angle to point
nicely punched. Rashid stands tall to punchily drive the length ball to the sweeper cover
slower delivery outside off, Morgan cuts off the back foot to Starc at third man who as to deal with plenty of boos as he fields
very short again outside off, Rashid looks to ramp the ball over the keeper with a delicate upper cut but misses
82,6 mph, full on off, Rashid whips the ball to mid-on with good use of the wrists
another pretty good bouncer at 81 mph, towards the batsman's throat again. Rashid misses his pull. Good tight over
very full on off, 91 mph, generating some impressive pace here is Cummins. Morgan skews the ball out to cover
another well-directed bouncer from Cummins. Impressive spell this. Morgan rolls his wrists on the ball to keep his pull down as the ball goes to deep square leg
good length again on middle and off, Rashid squirts the ball to cover off the outside half of the bat
another wicket. If England were in trouble then, they are in deeper trouble now. Fullish on off, Rashid clips the ball uppishly and straight to mid-on, where NCN takes a diving catch to his left.
great delivery to greet him though. good bouncer on middle, Plunkett awkwardly fends the ball into the leg side, just lobbed up into the leg side
what a response from the captain. Another bouncer at Morgan's helmet who gives himself some room and pulls the ball long and deep over the fine leg boundary.  Superlative batting.
good from Plunkett too. Good length outside off, pushed into the gap to the sweeper cover for one.
another good shot. Just picking his spots and executing perfectly. Good length outside off, Morgan makes some room and lofts the ball easily and effortlessly over mid-off

what an effort from NCN at the fine leg boundary. Good length on leg this time, Morgan clips the ball in the air with good timing. NCN takes a great catch and throws the ball back in at fine leg. NCN signals six to the umpire, but replays are inconclusive. Given six eventually.

the best of the lot. Morgan, you beauty. He skips down the track and absolutely clobbers the fuller length well over the long-on boundary. Not yet over this game. What a shot. Best of the day, for me.
nicely played again, just calmly pushing the full ball outside off to the sweeper cover for one
drifts on Plunkett's pads who whips to Starc at fine leg, who receives some more booing.
take four out of the 97, what a shot LP. Just calmly leans into the straight drive to get it past mid-off for four. Clever battin'
slightly short outside off, not much width though but Plunkett looks to cut. He is beaten on the outside edge
four more. Are Australia losing the plot here? Not a bad ball though. Shortish length on off, Plunkett gives himself room and heaves the length well over mid-on.
down leg this time. Cummins was looking to follow Plunkett who backed away, strays too wide though
and another one. WOW. Short and wide, definitely a poor delivery by Cummins. Plunkett gets behind the line and plays a really nice cut through point. Well timed too.
fourth boundary of the over. Just a hint too short from Cummins who swipes the ball through midwicket for another four runs.
just falls short. Plunkett drives the fullish length to mid-off. Smashed that. Lord's is bustling once again.
slower offcutter outside off, Morgan shuffles across but hits the man at point.
nice delivery, yorker on off stump, Morgan can only drill the ball to long-off
edged for four this time. Luck certainly favouring the brave Plunkett who advances and looks to force through the off side.
just the one this time. Very full outside off, Plunkett lofts the ball with no timing over cover
Morgan is at it again. What a shot. Absolutely stunning to watch. He gives himself some room and smashes the ball over cover for another boundary. Hmm, gettin' interestin'.
and another with not as much timing though. Very full and wide, Morgan skews the ball over cover for two.

Starc is accurate first up, silencing the crowd. A ball he has gained lots of applause for over the past few months. From around the wicket, full and straight with a hint of reverse. Plunkett backs away, makes room but is cleaned up. The leg stump is taken.
quick yorker attempted but ends up as a low full toss. Finn manages to keep it out.
wide from Starc. Goes for the bouncer but drifts down leg.
full and overpitched on leg, Finn does his job as he nurdles behind square for one
full yorker outside off, Morgan cannot get under that, he drives to cover and refuses the single
another well-executed yorker, speared in with some reverse on off, Morgan drives to mid-off
they manage to stop the single as well. Very quick low full toss, Morgan looks to heave but skews the ball to short cover who is tight on the one. Good captaincy
good length outside off, Finn chooses to leave the ball

oh, they steal the single. Good length but closer to off, Finn is hit on the thighs and Morgan calls him through for the single as the ball rolls towards point. There is a quick but inaccurate throw at the non-strikers end.

gone this time, that's the end of an amazing innings by Morgan and a really, good match. Australia win by 64 runs. Morgan and Smith have a chat while shaking hands. Good length outside off, Morgan looks to clear the long-off boundary with a heave but the ball lobs up nicely and sits in long-off's lap. Australia go 2-0 up in the five-match series.
